name: @YorkUScience
description: Advice for public health. Detect exoplanets. Work on drug discovery. Advocate for diversity and inclusion. Draft policy recommendations. Collaborate on dark matter research. Observe endangered species from their DNA in the air. Dive into cures for heart failure. Shed light into the aging process  and the brain. Plant the seeds urban meadows and the bumblebees. Reveal the origins of bees based on their genome. Study polar bear diet to learn about arctic warming. Analyze the warming of Northern lakes. Get involved in anticancer immunotherapy. Build the most powerful telescope today. Explore greener chemistry for tattoos. Focus on air quality and climate change. Advance dementia care. Model infection and immunity. Classify galaxies. Dedicate to EDI in the science curriculum. Tune in for exciting astronomy talk. Promote the use of Science in decision making. Engage in citizen science projects.
